eu.wauz.wauzcore.menu.collection

Class PetOptionsMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.wauz.wauzcore.menu.collection.PetOptionsMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WauzInventory

    public class PetOptionsMenu
extends java.lang.Object
implements WauzInventory
    An inventory that can be used as menu or for other custom interaction mechanics. Sub menu of the pet menu, that is used for interacting with a specific pet.
    Author:
    Wauzmons
    See Also:
    PetOverviewMenu

      • open

        public static void open(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                        java.lang.Integer petSlot)
        Opens the menu for the given player. Views the details of an pet and shows all possible interaction options. The first option is the summoning of the pet. The second option is to send the pet as parent to the breeding station, which may be disallowed for some pets. The third option is to release the pet back to the wild, deleting it permanently. All three stats of the pet will be shown differently based on their level. Level 0 = Raw Pork, Level X = Cooked Pork, Level Max = Beef. The levels can be increased by dragging food on these slots. Additionally there are options to move the pet one slot to the left or the right in the overview menu, aswell as an option to return to the overview menu.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that should view the inventory.
        petSlot - The slot of the pet to view.
        See Also:
        PlayerConfigurator#getCharacterPetType(Player, int), PlayerConfigurator#getCharcterPetBreedingDisallowString(Player, int), PlayerConfigurator#getCharacterPetIntelligence(Player, int), PlayerConfigurator#getCharacterPetDexterity(Player, int), PlayerConfigurator#getCharacterPetAbsorption(Player, int)

      • selectMenuPoint

        public void selectMenuPoint(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryClickEvent event)
        Checks if an event in this inventory was triggered by a player click. Cancels the event and tries to interact with the pet. Clicking the lead will summon the pet. Clicking the egg tries to move the pet to the breeding station. Clicking the barrier will show a dialog to release the pet. Clicking the porkchop with food on the cursor will feed the pet. Clicking left or right arrows will move the pet in the overview menu. Clicking the pufferfish egg will lead back to the overview menu.
        Specified by:
        selectMenuPoint in interface WauzInventory
        Parameters:
        event - The inventory click event.
        See Also:
        getIndex(InventoryView), summon(Player, Integer), breed(Player, int, ItemStack), discard(Player, Integer), feed(Player, int, ItemStack), move(Player, int, int, boolean), PetOverviewMenu.open(Player, int)

      • getIndex

        private static java.lang.Integer getIndex(org.bukkit.inventory.InventoryView inventory)
        Gets the index of a pet by reading the title of their options menu.
        Parameters:
        inventory - The inventory of the pet's options menu.
        Returns:
        The index of the pet.

      • summon

        public static void summon(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                          java.lang.Integer petSlot)
        Lets the given player summon a specific pet. Tries to remove the entity from an old pet first, if any exists. Sets the active pet id and slot, aswell as the pet's owner afterwards. Also recalculates the player movement speed, based on the pet's dexterity stat.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who summons the pet.
        petSlot - The slot of the pet being summoned.
        See Also:
        PlayerConfigurator#getCharacterPetType(Player, int), PlayerConfigurator#getCharacterActivePetId(Player), PlayerConfigurator#setCharacterActivePetId(Player, String), PlayerConfigurator#setCharacterActivePetSlot(Player, int), PetOverviewMenu.setOwner(String, Player)

      • discard

        public static void discard(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                           java.lang.Integer petSlot)
        Lets the given player release a pet into the wild, permanently deleting it. A confirm dialog is shown beforehand.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who discards the pet.
        petSlot - The slot of the pet being discarded.
        See Also:
        WauzPlayerEventPetDelete

      • move

        public static void move(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                        int fromIndex,
                        int toIndex,
                        boolean openMenu)
        Lets the given player move a pet to another slot in the overview menu. Unsummons the player's current pet, if it is affected from the movement. The config file gets directly edited with a file writer, to swap the slots. Afterwards the overview menu is opened, highlighting the pet's new position.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who moves the pet.
        fromIndex - The current overview index of the pet.
        toIndex - The new overview index of the pet.
        openMenu - If the overview should be opened afterwards.
        See Also:
        PlayerConfigurator#getCharacterActivePetSlot(Player), PetOverviewMenu.unsummon(Player), PetOverviewMenu.open(Player, int), BufferedReader, FileWriter

      • feed

        private static void feed(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                         int petSlot,
                         org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack statItem)
        Feeds the current pet, the item on the player's curser, to increase the given stat's exp. The exp gain is based on the food item's saturation modifier. If the pet's stat reaches a new level, the stat will be increased by 1 and the exp to the next level will be set. If the pet is active while reaching a new level, it will be unsummoned. If the max level is reached, this method won't be called anymore from the stat item interaction.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who feeds the pet.
        petSlot - The slot of the pet, that is getting fed.
        statItem - The item stack showing the pet stat.
        See Also:
        ItemUtils.isFoodItem(ItemStack), ItemUtils.getSaturation(ItemStack), PetOverviewMenu.unsummon(Player), PlayerConfigurator#getCharacterPetIntelligence(Player, int), PlayerConfigurator#setCharacterPetIntelligence(Player, int, int), PlayerConfigurator#getCharacterPetIntelligenceExpNeeded(Player, int), PlayerConfigurator#setCharacterPetIntelligenceExpNeeded(Player, int, int), PetOverviewMenu.getBaseExpToFeedingLevel(int)

      • breed

        public static void breed(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                         int petSlot,
                         org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack breedStack)
        Tries to add the pet to the breeding station, if it is allowed. The station must be free and the pet needs at least 1 maxed stat. A confirm dialog is shown beforehand.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who wants to breed the pet.
        petSlot - The slot of the pet to breed.
        breedStack - The breeding option item stack.
        See Also:
        WauzPlayerEventPetBreed
